application.name: skymap
application.brief: Convert camera image to a skymap projection
application.description:
This program converts a cube in camera coordinates to a map projection. It differs from the application "cam2map" in that it maps camera ra/dec (right acsension/declination) to map projection longitude/latitude. The program is useful for inflight geometric and optical distortion calibration of a camera when star images are collected. The input cube labels must have an Instrument Group and Kernels Group. That is, the program "spiceinit" should be run on the input cube prior to "skymap".
This program will pick appropriate defaults for most parameters. In particular for the MAP parameter, it will generate the following:
Group = Mapping TargetName = "Sky" EquatorialRadius = 1.0 PolarRadius = 1.0
LatitudeType = Planetocentric LongitudeDirection = PositiveEast LongitudeDomain = 360
MinimumLatitude = Computed from the input camera cube or map file MaximumLatitude = Computed from the input camera cube or map file MinimumLongitude = Computed from the input camera cube or map file MaximumLongitude = Computed from the input camera cube or map file
ProjectionName = Projection name in the map file Scale = Computed from the input camera cube or map file EndGroup
Note that although the map projection group reflects latitude/longitude, those values are synomous with declination/right ascension.
Note that an important concept here is a Mapping group can come from any PVL file. You can use an existing map projected cube as input for the MAP user parameter. Because the cube has PVL labels and contains the Mapping group, you will essentially force the input camera cube to have the same mapping parameters or match the existing cube. Information about map projections and the Mapping group can be found in the Isis user documentation.
Finally, the user has the option to override the pixel resolution and the ground range (latitude/longitude). These changes can be facilitied through the parameters SCALE, SRA, ERA, SDEC, and EDEC.

history.change: Fixed bug with program not using all keywords in the user MAP file
Fixed bug with garbage pixels being produced at extremities of the projected image edges.
Fixed bug, full mapping group was not written to cube labels. Also, updated documentation to correctly state that the RESOLUTION parameter is the IFOV of the camera .
Check to see if center of input image projects, if it does, force the tile containing center to be processed in ProcessRubberSheet.

Moved helper buttons and refined helper error checking
Mapping group parameters are now placed into the print file.

parameter.name: FROM
parameter.description: The specification of the input cube to be projected. The cube must contain a valid Instrument and Kernel group in the labels.

parameter.name: MAP
parameter.description: A file containing the desired output mapping parameters in PVL form. This file can be a simple hand produced label file. It can also be an existing cube label which contains a Mapping group.

helper.name: H1
helper.description: This helper button will cat out the mapping group of the given mapfile to the session log of the application

parameter.name: TO
parameter.description: This file will contain the sky as a map projected image.

parameter.name: DEFAULTSCALE
parameter.brief: Defines how the scale in the output map file is obtained
parameter.description: This parameter is used to specify how the scale is obtained for the output map projected cube.

helper.name: H1
helper.description: This helper button will load the default scale from the camera

helper.name: H2
helper.description: This helper button will load the default scale from the map file

option.description: This option will automatically determine the scale from the input cube specified using the FROM parameter.

option.brief: Read scale from input map file
option.description: This option will use the Scale (pixels/degree) in the map file.
This option allows the user to specify the resolution using the SCALE parameter. The scale should be entered in pixels/degree.

parameter.name: SCALE
parameter.description:
The number of pixels per degrees (RA/DEC). By default, the program attempts to compute this value as 1 / IFOV of the camera. Note you will typically need to convert IFOV in milli-or-micro radians to degrees. Alternatively, you can entered the scale in the MAP file in pixels per degrees (1 / IFOV). That is,
Group = Mapping ... Scale = 17000.0 End_Group End_Group

parameter.name: DEFAULTRANGE
parameter.brief: Defines how the default sky range is determined
parameter.description: This parameter is used to specify how the default ra/dec ground range for the output map projected image is obtained. Note the user can overide the default using the SRA, ERA, SDEC, EDEC parameters.

helper.name: H1
helper.description: This helper button will load the default sky range from the camera

helper.name: H2
helper.description: This helper button will load the default sky range from the map file

option.brief: Compute default range from input cube
option.description: This option will automatically determine the mininum/maximum ra/dec from the input camera model cube specified using the FROM parameter.

option.brief: Read default range from map file
option.description: This option will read the mininum/maximum ra/dec from the input map file. All four values are expected to be defined.

parameter.name: SRA
parameter.description: The starting right ascension of the sky map. If not entered it will be read computed from the CAMERA or read from the MAP file, depending on the option chosen for DEFAULTRANGE. If this value is entered, it will override the default value.

parameter.name: ERA
parameter.description: The ending right ascension of the sky map. If not entered it will be read computed from the CAMERA or read from the MAP file, depending on the option chosen for DEFAULTRANGE. If this value is entered, it will override the default value.

parameter.name: SDEC
parameter.description: The starting declination of the sky map. If not entered it will be read computed from the CAMERA or read from the MAP file, depending on the option chosen for DEFAULTRANGE. If this value is entered, it will override the default value.

parameter.name: EDEC
parameter.description: The ending declination of the sky map. If not entered it will be read computed from the CAMERA or read from the MAP file, depending on the option chosen for DEFAULTRANGE. If this value is entered, it will override the default value.

parameter.name: TRIM
parameter.description: If this option is selected, pixels outside the ra/dec range be trimmed or set to null. This is useful for certain projections whose lines of latitude and longitude are not parallel to image lines and sample columns.

parameter.name: INTERP
parameter.description: This is the type of interpolation to be performed on the input.

option.description: Each output pixel will be set to the pixel nearest the calculated input pixel.
Each output pixel will be set to the value calculated by a bi-linear interpolation of the calculated input pixel.
Each output pixel will be set to the value calculated by a cubic convolution interpolation of the calculated input pixel.
